position: Program Manager, Technology Campus / Early Careers - Tech Talent Excellence

location.country: New York, New York, United States

description:
“You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back. 

At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways.  Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible - and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way. When you join #TeamAmex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day.”

The Tech Talent Excellence team is undergoing a transformation!  With renewed focus on creating a sustainable pipeline to supply American Express Technology with the best and most diverse talent, we are creating new pathways to tech jobs through our Early Careers Program. We need a highly motivated, organized, and creative Program Manager to help us build out several new pathways to tech jobs through various work experience models, such as internships, apprenticeships, pre-internships, and career change opportunities.

Under the strategic direction of the Director, Early Careers Program, you will be responsible for designing, directing and coordinating multiple, ongoing work experience programs from design through implementation. In addition to managing relationships with key external strategic partners, you will lead project managers to execute individual workstreams and work closely with stakeholders to determine requirements for entry-level talent across various job functions. You will manage program costs and resources, while providing regular program status updates and communicating with stakeholders across the enterprise on program strategy, ensuring that scope and approach are fully understood by all stakeholders. You will coordinate across several programs to ensure proper staging of program activities in line with resource availability.

This is the ideal opportunity for someone who is:

  • Ambitious and eager to pursue new ideas
  • Self-starter with a "no task too small" mentality
  • Collaborative partner with high customer service acumen
  • Detail oriented, with strong communication and planning skills

Prior experience designing and implementing large-scale or complicated programs involving multiple stakeholders and external partners is a required.  Ideally you have implemented work experience programs, though other programmatic experience that is translatable will be considered as well.

Prior experience implementing programs (as described above).

 

Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.

Kabbage is expanding its rock-star Marketing team with a new Senior Manager, Copywriter to join us as we aim to help American small businesses grow and manage their cash flow.      

Acquired by American Express in 2020, Kabbage is pairing its leading FinTech platform with the powerful backing of AMEX to launch an innovative cash-flow platform to give the smallest businesses access to cutting-edge financial tools and services. Deeply data-driven and connected with its customers, Kabbage has a full suite of cash-flow products from flexible lines of credit, online business checking accounts, payment processing, predictive business analytics and more. While we've received numerous awards and recognition—such as Entrepreneur's Top Company Cultures, Inc Magazine's Top Private Companies, GlassDoor’s Best Places to Work, and Forbes FinTech 50—it is our people, our culture, and our leaders that make Kabbage such a great place to work.

Your mission:

Create compelling copy that drives results, from acquiring new customers and increasing utilization to creating an elegant user experience and building a trusted brand.

What you’ll be doing:

  • The Kabbage Marketing team is always perfecting its approach to customer acquisition and engagement, and copy plays a key role. You’ll develop copy that implements the Kabbage voice, promotes brand awareness and drives response across web, email, direct mail, display, social ads, video and other content channels.
  • You’ll support our User Experience team with technical copy that informs and engages. You’ll also work alongside the wider American Express team as the lead copy-champion for Kabbage.
  • This is a fantastic opportunity to write copy for a variety of channels, serve as a go-to resource for Kabbage, and become embedded in a leading global brand: American Express.

What we’re looking for in you:

  • Initiative: Scrappy and able to work in a fast-paced environment. Take direction based on creative parameters and business goals and run with the assignment.
  • Flexibility/Adaptability: Adjusts quickly to changing priorities and conditions; copes effectively with complexity and change.
  • Collaboration & Influence: ability to successfully influence and bring together internal and external stakeholders to achieve shared goals.
  • Communication: Able to see and communicate the big picture in an inspiring way; determines opportunities and threats through comprehensive analysis of current and future trends.
  • Creativity/Innovation: Balance brand consistency with the ability to push our creative direction to keep it fresh.

What you should have:

  • 6+ years of copywriting experience.
  • Ability to write across media and types of content, including web, email, direct mail, display and social channels.
  • Experience writing for a multi-product organization a plus.
  • Excellent writing, editing, and proofreading skills.
  • Emphasis on conversational, short-form copy that drives results.
  • Experience creating approachable, easy-to-follow user experiences.
  • Ability to translate complex topics into straightforward copy.
  • Link to your portfolio or 5-10 of your best writing samples.

Additional Details:

  • Ongoing Workplace Flexibility: Position will currently be work-from-home due to COVID-19.  American Express is committed to the well-being of its colleagues and to creating a safe work environment; colleagues will continue to work remotely until a return to the office can be safely accomplished.
  • Visa Sponsorship: Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for this position.
